params.transmitter: address to accept the payee role for

params.id: identifier of the upkeep to check

getActiveUpkeepIDs(uint256,uint256).details: the order of IDs in the list is **not guaranteed**, therefore, if making successive calls, one should consider keeping the blockheight constant to ensure a holistic picture of the contract state

params.gasLimit: the gas to calculate payment for

params.id: the upkeep id to calculate minimum balance for

returns.blockNumber: block at which this config was set
returns.configCount: ordinal number of current config, out of all configs applied to this contract so far

returns.scanLogs: indicates whether to rely on the configDigest and epoch returned or whether to scan logs for the Transmitted event instead.

params.destination: the address of the registry to migrate to

onTokenTransfer(address,uint256,bytes).details: safe to cast uint256 to uint96 as total LINK supply is under UINT96MAX

params.sender: the account which transferred the funds

params.encodedUpkeeps: abi encoding of upkeeps to import - decoded by the transcoder

recoverFunds().details: In principle this functions execution cost could exceed block gas limit. However, in our anticipated deployment, the number of upkeeps and transmitters will be low enough to avoid this problem.

params.admin: address to cancel upkeep and withdraw remaining funds
params.checkData: data passed to the contract when checking for upkeep
params.gasLimit: amount of gas to provide the target contract when performing upkeep

params.f: number of faulty oracles the system can tolerate
params.offchainConfig: serialized configuration used by the oracles exclusively and only passed through the contract
params.onchainConfig: serialized configuration used by the contract (and possibly oracles)
params.signers: addresses with which oracles sign the reports
params.transmitters: addresses oracles use to transmit the reports

params.payees: addresses corresponding to transmitters who are allowed to move payments which have been accrued

params.gasLimit: new gas limit for the upkeep
params.id: upkeep to be change the gas limit for

params.config: instructs oracles of offchain config preferences
params.id: upkeep to be change the gas limit for
identifier of the upkeep to execute the data with.
params.performData: calldata parameter to be passed to the target upkeep.

params.proposed: address to nominate for next payeeship
params.transmitter: address of the transmitter to transfer payee role

params.id: the upkeep id to transfer admin
params.proposed: address to nominate for the new upkeep admin

params.rawVs: ith element is the the V component of the ith signature
params.report: serialized report, which the signatures are signing.
params.reportContext: [0]: ConfigDigest, [1]: 27 byte padding, 4-byte epoch and 1-byte round, [2]: ExtraHash
params.rs: ith element is the R components of the ith signature on report. Must have at most maxNumOracles entries
params.ss: ith element is the S components of the ith signature on report. Must have at most maxNumOracles entries

params.id: the id of the upkeep whose check data needs to be updated

params.to: destination address for sending remaining funds
address to send the payment to

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

acceptPayeeship(address).notice: accepts the safe transfer of payee role for a transmitter

acceptUpkeepAdmin(uint256).notice: accepts the safe transfer of admin role for an upkeep

addFunds(uint256,uint96).notice: adds LINK funding for an upkeep by transferring from the sender's LINK balance

cancelUpkeep(uint256).notice: prevent an upkeep from being performed in the future

checkUpkeep(uint256).notice: simulated by keepers via eth_call to see if the upkeep needs to be performed. It returns the success status / failure reason along with the perform data payload.

getActiveUpkeepIDs(uint256,uint256).notice: retrieve active upkeep IDs. Active upkeep is defined as an upkeep which is not paused and not canceled.

getKeeperRegistryLogicAddress().notice: retrieves the address of the logic address

getMaxPaymentForGas(uint32).notice: calculates the maximum payment for a given gas limit

getMinBalanceForUpkeep(uint256).notice: calculates the minimum balance required for an upkeep to remain eligible

getPeerRegistryMigrationPermission(addre.notice: retrieves the migration permission for a peer registry

getSignerInfo(address).notice: read the current info about any signer address

getState().notice: read the current state of the registry

getTransmitterInfo(address).notice: read the current info about any transmitter address

getUpkeep(uint256).notice: read all of the details about an upkeep

latestConfigDetails().notice: information about current offchain reporting protocol configuration

latestConfigDigestAndEpoch().notice: optionally returns the latest configDigest and epoch for which a report was successfully transmitted. Alternatively, the contract may return scanLogs set to true and use Transmitted events to provide this information to offchain watchers.

migrateUpkeeps(uint256[],address).notice: Migrates upkeeps from one registry to another, including LINK and upkeep params. Only callable by the upkeep admin. All upkeeps must have the same admin. Can only migrate active upkeeps.

onTokenTransfer(address,uint256,bytes).notice: uses LINK's transferAndCall to LINK and add funding to an upkeep

pause().notice: signals to transmitters that they should not perform upkeeps until the contract has been unpaused

receiveUpkeeps(bytes).notice: Called by other registries when migrating upkeeps. Only callable by other registries.

recoverFunds().notice: recovers LINK funds improperly transferred to the registry

setConfig(address[],address[],uint8,byte.notice: sets offchain reporting protocol configuration incl. participating oracles

setPayees(address[]).notice: update the list of payees corresponding to the transmitters

setPeerRegistryMigrationPermission(addre.notice: sets the peer registry migration permission

setUpkeepGasLimit(uint256,uint32).notice: allows the admin of an upkeep to modify gas limit

setUpkeepOffchainConfig(uint256,bytes).notice: allows the admin of an upkeep to modify the offchain config

simulatePerformUpkeep(uint256,bytes).notice: simulates the upkeep with the perform data returned from checkUpkeep

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

transferPayeeship(address,address).notice: proposes the safe transfer of a transmitter's payee to another address

transferUpkeepAdmin(uint256,address).notice: proposes the safe transfer of an upkeep's admin role to another address

transmit(bytes32[3],bytes,bytes32[],byte.notice: transmit is called to post a new report to the contract

typeAndVersion().notice: versions: - KeeperRegistry 2.0.2: pass revert bytes as performData when target contract reverts                       : fixes issue with arbitrum block number                       : does an early return in case of stale report instead of revert - KeeperRegistry 2.0.1: implements workaround for buggy migrate function in 1.X - KeeperRegistry 2.0.0: implement OCR interface - KeeperRegistry 1.3.0: split contract into Proxy and Logic                       : account for Arbitrum and Optimism L1 gas fee                       : allow users to configure upkeeps - KeeperRegistry 1.2.0: allow funding within performUpkeep                       : allow configurable registry maxPerformGas                       : add function to let admin change upkeep gas limit                       : add minUpkeepSpend requirement                       : upgrade to solidity v0.8 - KeeperRegistry 1.1.0: added flatFeeMicroLink - KeeperRegistry 1.0.0: initial release

unpause().notice: signals to transmitters that they can perform upkeeps once again after having been paused

updateCheckData(uint256,bytes).notice: update the check data of an upkeep

upkeepTranscoderVersion().notice: Specifies the version of upkeep data that this registry requires in order to import

upkeepVersion().notice: Specifies the version of upkeep data that this registry requires in order to import

withdrawFunds(uint256,address).notice: removes funding from a canceled upkeep

withdrawOwnerFunds().notice: withdraws LINK funds collected through cancellation fees

withdrawPayment(address,address).notice: withdraws a transmitter's payment, callable only by the transmitter's payee

documentation.text:
@notice versions:
 - KeeperRegistry 2.0.2: pass revert bytes as performData when target contract reverts
                       : fixes issue with arbitrum block number
                       : does an early return in case of stale report instead of revert
 - KeeperRegistry 2.0.1: implements workaround for buggy migrate function in 1.X
 - KeeperRegistry 2.0.0: implement OCR interface
 - KeeperRegistry 1.3.0: split contract into Proxy and Logic
                       : account for Arbitrum and Optimism L1 gas fee
                       : allow users to configure upkeeps
 - KeeperRegistry 1.2.0: allow funding within performUpkeep
                       : allow configurable registry maxPerformGas
                       : add function to let admin change upkeep gas limit
                       : add minUpkeepSpend requirement
                       : upgrade to solidity v0.8
 - KeeperRegistry 1.1.0: added flatFeeMicroLink
 - KeeperRegistry 1.0.0: initial release
